txt.en: Use the Instance Finder to enter \qAmdân Dammul, the Bloody Threshold\q
'At last... my suffering... is over....'
Talk to Durin
Fight towards Gundabad
'Zhélruka, Stout-axes, stay here and guard the door. The Longbeards and my heroes will accept Gorgar's challenge.'
Talk to Durin

'These dishonourable Orcs knew we would defeat them in battle, so they sprung a trap to cut us off from the rest of our forces!'

Durin fumes and grinds his teeth, furious at this turn of events. He looks around at the faces of the dwarves trapped with you on this side of the bridge. They show a mix of concern and anger of their own. Durin hardens his resolve and turns toward the open door to the arena.

'We cannot falter, [placeholder]. There are too many depending on us. Gorgar will have his way, for now. We will overcome any challenge put before us! Gundabad will be ours, this I swear!'
'Let's see how they handle Bardhrukh, or as my boys call him... THE KILLBEAST!'
'This isn't over, Gorgar!'
The bridge has been destroyed!
Survive Gorgar's Arena
'No, stop! I cannot tread in daylight! The witch's curse!'

'The day is won, but a dragon-sized obstacle now stands in our way. Despite this new challenge, I will never give up. I swore to claim Gundabad for the dwarves, and that is what I will do. I would have you by my side, if you will continue to trust in my leadership.\n\n'For now, we must regroup, tend to our wounded, and find a way to get through this ice! You have earned this reward, Champion [placeholder]. You have the thanks of the Longbeards, and the Zhélruka, and the Stout-axes!'
'Archers, take aim!'
Talk to Durin
You have claimed victory, but the way into Gundabad has been frozen shut!
'Your turn will come soon enough, hobgoblin. But, back to the matter at hand!'

'[placeholder], I am glad to have you with us. I will soon call for the charge. We will face much Orkish resistance and I will challenge Gorgar the Ruthless for lordship of Gundabad. One final matter remains....

'[placeholder], I name you and your fellows Heroes of Durin's Folk! May we achieve glory and victory side by side!

'When you are ready, we begin the charge! Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!'
'Scatter, vermin!'
'Then I am with you, as are all these brave Longbeards.'
'Gorgar, your foolhardy plan has failed! In the Warlord's name, I demand you face these invaders yourself!'
Durin has called for your aid in the final battle with Gorgar the Ruthless.\n\nUse the Instance Finder to enter \qAmdân Dammul, the Bloody Threshold\q on any difficulty.
'Oh, you're right about that, little Princeling!'
The final battle for Gundabad is about to begin.\n\nYou should speak to Durin inside Amdân Dammul, the Bloody Threshold.
Lead the charge towards Gundabad!
'Bow down before the true Master of Gundabad!'
The Orcs' trap has been sprung!\n\nYou should speak to Durin inside Amdân Dammul, the Bloody Threshold.
'Náin the Slakeless led our forces to victory!'
'The Orcs flee back to the mountain! The field is ours!'
'I will protect the rear! Baruk Khazâd! Khazâd ai-mênu!'
'You have earned the right to face ME, Gorgar the Ruthless, Son of Bolg, and Lord of Gundabad! Prepare yourselves.'
'Ready....'
'Look at that! The dwarves killed the Killbeast!'
'What a disappointment. All right, fun's over, boys. Time to finish this.'
'Enough talking, let's get to the fighting.'
'Oh no. That sounded like....'
'Aye. We must face whatever Orkish trickery this is with courage.'
Gorgar has sprung a trap and forces you and your dwarf allies to fight in his arena.\n\nYou should fight in Gorgar's arena and survive!
The day is won, but Hrímil Frost-heart has returned and claimed Gundabad!\n\nYou should talk to Durin.
'You don't disappoint, Durin! Your heroes are quite skilled.'
'I have one last beast in my stables; a worthy mount for the Heir of Azog.'
'I have returned to claim what is mine!'
'Easy there. You had best co-operate if you know what's good for you, warg.'
'Well done, heroes!'
Suddenly, you hear a loud roar echo over the mountain!
'I will do my best, Ingór.'
The Orcs are not amused with your performance!
'Hrímil Frost-heart? How can this be?'
'What's wrong with a bit of fun? They can't escape, and nothing boosts morale like watching some tarks scurry like insects at the feet of... well we wouldn't want to spoil the surprise!'
'Bring out the warg-chief, boys!'
'We have tamed a variety of beasts for war. They are cunning, vicious, and most of all... hungry for fresh meat!'
'Dishonourable cur!'
'Hah! I like this one!'
'Everyone! Get off the ramparts!'
'Did you forget about the rest of us, Orc?'
'Oh I will, hobgoblin... but you will first!'
'Stand with us! We will shield you from the flames!'
'Heroes! To me!'
'The hobgoblins were right!'
'Was that all you could muster, Gorgar? You have lost! Surrender now!'
'I will kill them all, and then I am coming for YOU, Gorgar!'
'My heroes, push forward! We rally at the steps of Gundabad!'
'All is not lost, my Prince.'
'We are pushing them back. It is time to press the attack!'
'You cowards! Come down here and face us!'
'Face now the Beasts of Slaughter!'
'What a pathetic showing by the dwarves! At least the beasts will eat well tonight! Hah!'
'When you're ready to face your certain doom, blow the horn!'
'Hmph. We will be watching, Gorgar.'
''We accept your challenge, Gorgar. Despite your dishonourable ploys, we will overcome you!'
'...a trap.'
'What?! Not now! I was so close!'
'ENOUGH! I AM NO ONE'S MOUNT!'
'Ready yourselves, the first bout will begin soon!'
'Too easy.'
'May you die with 'honour', pushdugs!'
'As you say, Durin. Try not to die in there.'
'The dragon!'
'We cannot go back with the bridge destroyed! I don't think we have much choice but to obey them.'
'For Gundabad!'
'Here you will face overwhelming odds and be smashed to a bloody pulp for the pleasure of my soldiers.'
'Gundabad will be ours!'
'The Prince has crossed! Bat-riders, NOW!'
'You wanted me to command the defence of Urbhármokh, so let me do it my way!'
'Hah! That's the spirit! It's always more fun when the prey is this lively!'
'I leave you to die at the hands of these dwarves!'
'Cross the bridge! Our goal is in sight!'
'You are right, Commander. All is not lost!'
'Haha! The day is ours! Rush the gate!'
TBD Raid Narrative
'My life... for... the Frost-horde....'
The Bloody Threshold
'My Prince, I must again say it is too dangerous to lead the vanguard yourself. Is there anything I can say to make you reconsider?'
'Welcome, little Princeling, to my arena!'
'Prove worthy of their aid!'
'AAARGH! I WILL KILL YOU ALL FOR THIS!'
'I appreciate your concern, Commander, but this is something I must do. A true leader must be willing to lay down his life for his people.'
'None can stand against Gorgar the Ruthless!'
TBD
'Worthless mongrel! Have it your way!'
'Shields up!'
The time has come to face Gorgar the Ruthless and claim lordship of Gundabad.
'The pain....'
'It will take time to regroup, tend to the wounded, and break through this cursed ice.... But the day is won!'
'Dwarves, with me! For Gundabad!'
'Good warg. To battle!'
'Something tells me those two aren't on friendly terms....'
'For Gundabad!'
The Frost-heart!'
'Well said, nephew!'
'No... we were so close! Our prize slips from our grasp once more.'
'The Zhélruka are with you as well, Durin.'
'Gorgar invites you to enter the arena, dwarves! Get moving, or we slaughter you all where you stand!'
'Orcs, retreat! Get inside the mountain!'
'Wait, something is wrong. There should be more Orcs than this... I think this might be...'
'I am a Chieftain of Wargs!'
TBD
TBD
'For the Zhélruka clan!'
'The time has come to bring this war to its end. Muster your allies and prepare for a fierce battle. Join me, [placeholder], as we bring the fight to Gorgar the Ruthless, and claim Gundabad!'
'Gorgar, if this little game of yours fails, Warlord Dushtalbúk will not be pleased. You should just kill them now.'
'Aye. We could see the battle's ending from across the bridge.'
'And the Stout-axe!'
'Aye, the time has come.'
'The warg chieftain is victorious! I guess you get to live, mongrel!'
